intro: Cephalophora heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf cephalophora, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant exhibits notable morphological variation, with leaves that can be either simple or compound depending on environmental conditions. Its flowers are typically yellow and are arranged in a head, surrounded by bracts. Cephalophora heterophylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
